summary: This document is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York daily lieutenant's log for July 12, 2019, covering three shifts. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and movements, including noting an inmate on suicide watch and several inmates placed in administrative detention pending investigation. The log is significant as it documents the facility's operations on a day when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there, though he is not explicitly named.

events.title: Daily Operations at MCC New York
events.description: Routine correctional facility operations including multiple inmate counts, body alarm tests, equipment checks, and inmate movements to/from court, hospital, and general population.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: An inmate (not named in the log) was subject to an immediate use of force and subsequently placed on suicide watch during the Day Watch shift.

events.title: Inmates Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Several inmates (identified by register numbers 76320-054, 76321-054, 76319-054, 76322-054, and others) were moved to administrative detention (ZA) pending investigation throughout the Evening Watch shift.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log records operations at the MCC New York on July 12, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there prior to his death.
An inmate was placed on suicide watch following an 'immediate use of force' during the afternoon of July 12, 2019.
Multiple inmates were placed in administrative detention 'Pending Investigation' during the evening shift.
The log notes an inmate was at a local hospital with USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) guards, indicating a high-security or high-profile detainee.
Standard operating procedures like PREA announcements, counts, and equipment checks were documented, with some system malfunctions noted.
